melismagus: I'm a 28 year old woman. After a childhood experience it was ingrained in me that pleasure is shameful, and even after doing some things out of a natural desire/search for pleasure (reading and writing erotica, having sex, getting a toy...) there's always a shame subtext. I know I'm very sexual but feel kinda trapped somehow. I've been told -by an expert- my second chakra is blocked, tho I don't know much about those things, and also that my hip/waist area feels blocked and without energy. I think this manifests -among other things- in an inability to do the girl on top position -my hips feel somehow weak and lost and i get anxious- and my inability to dance -which is a big source of shame for me, not being able to do something everyone does, when I try I get anxious and feel stiff af-. It's like a mental and physical stiffness I've always felt specially regarding sexuality and sensuality. Please, @evyan.whitney if you have any advice or resources that can help me I'll be eternally grateful, I feel like I'm not fully living or fully enjoying myself. Thank you for everything you do 🌸✨

alexis.fernandz: I feel you! I also used to have a very hard time with sitting meditation and was attracted more towards movement meditation. There’s a reason for this! Across many cultures movement meditation is used to prepare the body for sitting meditation. It opens the channels and lets things start flowing. Both yoga and qigong are traditionally used to prepare the body for sitting. You should try sitting again after some time with this practice and see if things have changed!
